Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Tonka Crash said:
> 
> 
> It really doesn't matter what <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> says, <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> doesn't really know. It's "compatbile" mods are based on a text file the mod maker included the last time the mod was updated. This has little to do with what versions of KSP the mod will actually work with. Last time I looked I have mods from 1.4.1 running fine on 1.7. 
> 
> 
> 
> Since 1.4 most mods will work with the latest versions of KSP. There are exceptions: Kopernicus has a unique release for each KSP version and KSP 1.7 did break a handful of mods like <abbr style="border-bottom:none;" title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr>, KPBS and Wind Tunnel. It's usually safe to assume mods are compatible with new KSP versions unless you see problems and the forum thread is filling up with people claiming﻿ the mod ﻿is broken.
> 

The new expansion (coming in May) is probably going to break a lot of mods. But its putting a lot of neat stuff into the game - so mods that expand Action Groups, and the infernal robotics stuff are likely not going to be needed anymore.

> 
> 
> Just now, Murdabenne said:
> 
> 
> The new expansion (coming in May) is probably going to break a lot of mods. But its putting a lot of neat stuff into the game - so mods that expand Action Groups, and the infernal robotics stuff are likely not going to be needed anymore.
> 

Really it's a wait and see. As long as the Unity version doesn't change the only things I'd expect to break would be where the next version changes existing functionality.

Can someone explain why I am unable to transfer crew from the docked crew transport middle left to the SSTU rotating habs? Each has no current crew and room for 35. Hatches are open, all module say they're passable, but as you see it won't let me transfer crew to any part of the station.

![aXvcS8a.png](https://i.imgur.com/aXvcS8a.png)

> 
> 
> On 7/27/2019 at 2:06 AM, vossiewulf said:
> 
> 
> Can someone explain why I am unable to transfer crew from the docked crew transport middle left to the SSTU rotating habs? Each has no current crew and room for 35. Hatches are open, all module say they're passable, but as you see it won't let me transfer crew to any part of the station.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![aXvcS8a.png](https://i.imgur.com/aXvcS8a.png)](https://i.imgur.com/aXvcS8a.png "Enlarge image")
> 

I had this issue earlier with my space station and my crew module. You can select "Allow Unrestricted Crew Transfers" in the CLS options to fix it for now. 

I need to check that the docking ports are setup correctly to allow CLS crew passable. 

Make sure the hatch is open and if you EVA someone and pop them back in you can then transfer crew properly without the above setting enabled. Weird bug. 

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-28T23:28:55Z" title="07/28/2019 11:28  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 28, 2019</time> by madindehead**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, madindehead said:
> 
> 
> I had this issue earlier with my space station and my crew module. You can select "Allow Unrestricted Crew Transfers" in the CLS options to fix it for now. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I need to check that the docking ports are setup correctly to allow CLS crew passable. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Make sure the hatch is open and if you EVA someone and pop them back in you can then transfer crew properly without the above setting enabled. Weird bug.
> 

Thanks for the tip, I will try that. Out of frustration I had removed CLS, and was immediately able to transfer crew without problem, so it's definitely a CLS issue and it does seem to be an issue where it simply will not permit transfers through a docking port- I am not building in situ but launching each module and docking it. And all docking port hatches are open.

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-29T00:12:46Z" title="07/29/2019 12:12  AM" data-short="4 yr">July 29, 2019</time> by vossiewulf**
The EVA trick seemed to work best for me. Slight annoyance to dock and then EVA someone from the newly docked module but it worked once. I need to test it again to recreate it!
That's a long-standing bug in CLS — been  happening since KSP 1.5, IIRC.  It doesn't notice changes in hatch open/closed status until you switch vessels or scenes.

[@Wyzard](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/162363-wyzard/) [@madindehead](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/198474-madindehead/) [@vossiewulf](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/179033-vossiewulf/) Try [@taniwha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57176-taniwha/)'s [fork](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/109972-14x-connected-living-space-v1262-13-jun-2018/&do=findComment&comment=3531968) or just flip back to the previous page of this thread. CLS has bug free for me in 1.7.3. Taniwha forked CLS after Papa Joe had been <abbr title="Missing in action">MIA</abbr> for a few months and released a patched version specifically for the bug you guys are seeing.

I'm having a similar issue, but none of your fixes actually seem to work.  I'm just... needing to EVA crew no matter what.
...so, as it turns out, you need to open \*both\* hatches.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, horngeek said:
> 
> 
> ...so, as it turns out, you need to open \*both\* hatches.
> 

There is also an [updated version with a fix made by taniwha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/109972-14x-connected-living-space-v1262-13-jun-2018/page/23/&tab=comments#comment-3531968) which removes the bug. But yes...you need to open the hatches too ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

**Edited <time datetime="2019-09-18T15:15:24Z" title="09/18/2019 03:15  PM" data-short="4 yr">September 18, 2019</time> by Stone Blue**

Anybody know what's happened to [@Papa_Joe](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/10788-papa_joe/)?  He hasn't been on since March.

There are a few mods he supports (such as this) which either are in , or will need of a recompile

Has anyone tried with 1.8 ?

Cheers

SJ

> 
>

Just heard from [@Papa_Joe](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/10788-papa_joe/), he is back and working on catching up

Fantastic - one of my favourite mods.

Quick feature request: I have a large vessel with over 200 berths, it's a little tricky to manage the crew roster at times. I use Crew transfer a lot to move crew around various modules. However it can be a laborious process, as it's not possible to tell on the transfer window what each Kerbal specialises in. E.g. Engineer, Biologist, Pilot, etc... Would it be possible to add the profession to the interface ?

Thanks - and appreciate you may not be making changes, but thanks anyway for maintaining it.

Regards,

SJ

> 
> 
> On 11/12/2019 at 4:39 AM, serjames said:
> 
> 
> Has anyone tried with 1.8?
> 

For the record, I just recompiled [@taniwha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57176-taniwha/)s fork against 1.8.1 / .NET 4.7.1 (I think ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")), and added some obvious missing references. It appears to work just fine. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  

Not difficult, should hold the impatient over while  [@Papa_Joe](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/10788-papa_joe/) gets an official update together.
